info.title: NLPearl Client API
info.description: A sample API that demonstrates features in the OpenAPI specification

200.description: Account Information

get.description: Retrieves the list of users for the account

200.description: users list

get.description: Retrieves all active phone numbers of the account.

200.description: The list of active phone numbers for the account.

get.description: Retrieves the available voices grouped by language.

200.description: The list of available voices grouped by language.

get.description: Retrieves all the information about a call

200.description: Call information

schema.description: Represents the request object used to delete one or more calls.
Represents the request object used to delete one or more calls.
Represents the request object used to delete one or more calls.

200.description: Returns a boolean indicating if the deletion was successful.

post.description: Adds a new lead to a specified outbound

200.description: Id of the added lead.

put.description: Updates the details of an existing lead associated with a specific outbound campaign.

schema.description:
Represents the data used to update an existing lead in an outbound campaign.
All fields are optional; only the provided values will be updated.

Represents the data used to update an existing lead in an outbound campaign.
All fields are optional; only the provided values will be updated.

Represents the data used to update an existing lead in an outbound campaign.
All fields are optional; only the provided values will be updated.

200.description: The updated lead is returned.

400.description: The request is invalid or the data is malformed.

get.description: Retrieves details of a specific lead within a outbound

200.description: Details of the specific lead.

post.description: Retrieves the leads associated with a specific outbound

schema.description: Extends TableSearch to include specific search criteria for leads.
Extends TableSearch to include specific search criteria for leads.
Extends TableSearch to include specific search criteria for leads.

200.description: List of leads for the outbound.

delete.description: Deletes one or more leads associated with a specific outbound campaign.

schema.description: Represents the request object for deleting one or more leads associated with an outbound campaign.
Represents the request object for deleting one or more leads associated with an outbound campaign.
Represents the request object for deleting one or more leads associated with an outbound campaign.

200.description: Returns a boolean indicating if the deletion was successful.

get.description: Retrieves details of a specific lead within an outbound

200.description: Details of the specific lead.

get.description: Retrieves details of a specific lead within an outbound via phone number

200.description: Details of the specific lead.

delete.description: Deletes one or more leads associated with a specific outbound campaign.

schema.description: Represents the request object for deleting one or more leads associated with an outbound campaign using external identifiers.
Represents the request object for deleting one or more leads associated with an outbound campaign using external identifiers.
Represents the request object for deleting one or more leads associated with an outbound campaign using external identifiers.

List of all the pearls for the client.

requestBody.description: The Pearl flow configuration to create.

200.description: The ID of the newly created Pearl.

get.description: Retrieves a specific Pearl by its ID

200.description: Details of the specific Pearl.

put.description: Updates the settings for the specified Pearl.

parameters.name: pearlId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the Pearl.

200.description: The Pearl flow was updated successfully.

put.description: Run or Pause a specific Pearl

schema.description: Defines the request structure for setting the active status of an entity.
Defines the request structure for setting the active status of an entity.
Defines the request structure for setting the active status of an entity.

200.description: The active state of the Pearl.

post.description: Retrieves the calls within a specific date range of a pearl

200.description: Calls within the specified date range for inbound.

get.description: Returns the number of active calls currently in progress for the specified Pearl. If the Pearl has inbound configurations, it also returns the number of calls currently in queue.

200.description: Details of the specific inbound.

schema.description: Represents a date range used to query analytics data.
Represents a date range used to query analytics data.
Represents a date range used to query analytics data.

200.description: Returns an object containing the analytics data for the specified outbound campaign.

400.description: The request was invalid. Possible causes include a missing or malformed outbound ID, or errors in the search parameters.

put.description: Resets stored memory associated with a specific customer's phone number for a given Pearl.

200.description: Memory reset successful.

get.description: Retrieves the Settings for the specified Pearl. The Pearl and Variables sections in the response are populated only if the Pearl was created via the API. If the Pearl was created through the platform interface, these fields will be returned empty.

parameters.name: pearlId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the Pearl.

200.description: The settings for the specified Pearl.

put.description: Updates the outbound settings for the specified Pearl.

parameters.name: pearlId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the Pearl.

200.description: Outbound settings updated successfully.

400.description: The request is invalid or the data is malformed.

put.description: Updates the inbound settings for the specified Pearl.

parameters.name: pearlId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the Pearl.

200.description: Inbound settings updated successfully.

400.description: The request is invalid or the data is malformed.

key.description:
The request body field name (JSON key).
            
Max 255 characters only.

variableId.description:
The variable ID to send as the value for this field (without curly braces).
            
Constraints:
- If VariableId is provided, Type and Value must be null/empty.

type.description:
`1 - String`

`2 - Long`

`3 - Double`

`4 - Boolean`

`5 - DateOnly`

`6 - TimeOnly`

`7 - DateTime`

value.description:
` May support variables`
            
The static value to send for this field.
            
Constraints:
- Max 255 characters.
- Must be provided together with Type when VariableId is not provided.
- Must not be provided when VariableId is provided.
- When Type is String, the value may include variables using curly braces.

required.description: Indicates whether this request body field is required.

name.description:
A friendly name for this API action.
            
Max 50 characters only.

endpointUrl.description:
` May support variables`
            
The endpoint URL to call.
            
Max 4,000 characters only.
            
Variables support depends on when this API action is executed:
- Pre-call: pre-call variables only.
- In-call: pre-call and in-call variables.
- End-call: pre-call, in-call, and post-call variables.

body.description:
Request body definition (key/value pairs) for this API call.
            
Constraints:
- Only applicable for POST, PUT, or PATCH.
- Must be empty for GET, DELETE (and any method that does not send a body).

headers.description: Optional HTTP headers to include in the API request.

triggerDescription.description:
Describes when this API action should be triggered.
            
Max 1,000 characters only.

pearl.description: Conversation flow and agent behavior configuration for the Pearl.

variables.description:
Variables that can be defined, stored, and used by the agent during conversations.
For details on variable groups and how to use variables in supported fields, see: [Flow Variables](/api-reference/flow_variables)

inbound.description: Inbound settings for the Pearl. Required when creating an inbound Pearl. Must not be provided together with Outbound.

outbound.description: Outbound settings for the Pearl. Required when creating an outbound Pearl. Must not be provided together with Inbound.

name.description:
The display name of the agent.

Constraints:
- Max length: 50 characters.

voiceId.description:
The ID of the voice to use for this agent.
To retrieve available voices, see: [Get Voices](/api-reference/v2/pearlSettings/get-voices)
            
Constraints:
- The voice language must be unique across agents in the same Pearl (no two agents can use voices from the same language).

callsStatusOverview.description: Provides an overview of call counts by status for the selected period.

callsSentimentOverview.description: Provides an overview of call sentiment distribution for the selected period.

callsStatusTimeLine.description: Provides the timeline of call statuses over time for the selected period.

callsAverageTimeLine.description: Provides the timeline of average call duration over time for the selected period.

callsCostTimeLine.description: Provides the timeline of call cost over time for the selected period.

callsPickupRateTimeLine.description: Provides the timeline of pickup rate over time for the selected period (outbound only).

callsSuccessRateTimeLine.description: Provides the timeline of success rate over time for the selected period.

callLabelCount.description: Provides the distribution of labels applied to calls for the selected period.

callEventsCounts.description: Provides the total number of call events by event type for the selected period.

callsByHourDayOfWeeks.description: Provides call volume grouped by hour and day of week for the selected period.

callType.description:
Defines the type of activity of the pearl.

`1 - Inbound`

`2 - Outbound`

id.description: The unique identifier of the call.

pearlId.description: The unique identifier of the Pearl (API v2).

relatedId.description: The unique identifier of the inbound/outbound (API v1).

leadId.description:
If the call is outbound, this is the unique identifier of the lead that was called.
Otherwise, this value is null.

startTime.description: The date and time when the call processing started.

conversationStatus.description:
The outcome of the conversation during the call.

To determine the definition of 'Success' or 'Not Successful,' please refer to the [Create a Pearl](/pages/create_pearl#pearl-name) page at step 4.

`10 - NeedRetry`

`20 - InCallQueue`

`40 - OnCall`

`70 - VoiceMailLeft`

`100 - Success`

`110 - NotSuccessful`

`130 - Completed`

`150 - Unreachable`

`220 - Blacklisted`

`300 - QueueAbandon`

`500 - Error`

status.description:
Represents the current status of a call.

`3 - InProgress`

`4 - Completed`

`5 - Busy`

`6 - Failed`

`7 - NoAnswer`

`8 - Canceled`

from.description: The phone number from which the call was made.

to.description: The phone number to which the call was made.

name.description: The name associated with the call, if available.

duration.description: The duration of the call in seconds.

recording.description: The URL of the recording of the call, if available.

transcript.description: The transcript of the conversation, represented as a list of chat messages.

collectedInfo.description: A List containing information collected during the call.

tags.description: The tags or labels triggered during the conversation

isCallTransferred.description: Indicates whether the call was transferred to a human or another endpoint.

overallSentiment.description:
Represents the overall emotional tone detected from the client during the conversation.

`1 - Negative`

`2 - SlightlyNegative`

`3 - Neutral`

`4 - SlightlyPositive`

`5 - Positive`

collectedInfos.description: The information collected during the conversations.

apiSettings.description: API action to trigger when the notification conditions are met.

emailTemplate.description: Email template to send when the notification conditions are met.

indicatorTagsIds.description:
List of indicator tag IDs that must be detected to trigger this notification.
            
Important:
- These must be tag IDs from IndicatorTags (IndicatorTag.Id), not tag names.

CallEventsCount.description: Summary of events that occurred during calls.

id.description:
Identifier of the label.
            
If not provided, it will be generated automatically.
            
Important:
- The ID is the stable identifier of the label.
- Changing the ID creates a new label.
- Keeping the same ID while updating the name/description updates the existing label.
            
Constraints:
- Exactly 6 characters.
- Letters only (AZ, az).

name.description:
The label name.
            
Max 25 characters only.

description.description:
Describes when this label should be applied.
            
Max 250 characters only.

color.description:
`1 - purple`

`2 - red`

`3 - yellow`

`4 - green`

`5 - blue`

`6 - pink`

`7 - teal`

`8 - lime`

`8 - gradient1`

`9 - gradient2`

startTime.description: The date and time when the call processing started.

conversationStatus.description:
The outcome of the conversation during the call.

To determine the definition of 'Success' or 'Not Successful,' please refer to the [Create a Pearl](/pages/create_pearl#pearl-name) page at step 4.

`10 - NeedRetry`

`40 - OnCall`

from.description: The phone number from which the call was made.

to.description: The phone number to which the call was made.

duration.description: The duration of the call in seconds.

tags.description: The tags or labels triggered during the conversation

count.description: The total number of items matching the search criteria.

results.description: The list of results for the current page, based on the search criteria.

dayOfWeek.description:
`0 - Sunday`

`1 - Monday`

`2 - Tuesday`

`3 - Wednesday`

`4 - Thursday`

`5 - Friday`

`6 - Saturday`

CallsSentimentOverview.description: Overview of sentiment analysis results for the client during calls.

CallsStatusAnalyticsOverview.description: Overview of call statuses (e.g. success, failed, no answer).

CallsStatusTimeLine.description: Overview of call statuses (e.g. success, failed, no answer).

skip.description: Number of entries to skip for pagination.

limit.description: Limit on the number of entries to return.

isAscending.description: Whether the sort order is ascending.

fromDate.description: The start date for filtering the search results.

toDate.description: The end date for filtering the search results.

tags.description: List of tags to filter by.

statuses.description: List of Status to filter by.

status.description:
Represents the authorization status for making calls.

`1 - FullAccess`

`2 - LimitedAccess`

`3 - NoCredits`

`4 - SuspendedAccount`

`5 - DebtReached`

id.description: The unique identifier of the phone number.

number.description: The phone number in E.164 format.

direction.description:
Phone number direction (supported call capabilities).

- InboundOutbound: Supports both inbound and outbound calls.
- Inbound: Supports inbound calls only.
- Outbound: Supports outbound calls only.
- NotSet: Direction is not set.

`1 - InboundOutbound`

`2 - Inbound`

`3 - Outbound`

`10 - NotSet`

id.description: The ID of the variable collected

name.description: The display name of the variable collected.

value.description: The value of the variable collected.

id.description:
Variable identifier.
            
This is the ID you must reference when using the variable in scripts and templated fields.
It must not contain spaces.
            
Constraints:
- Max 40 characters.
- Allowed characters: letters (AZ, az), digits (09), underscore (_), hyphen (-).

name.description:
Friendly display name for the variable.
            
Max 40 characters only.

group.description:
Variable group.

- PreCall: Variables available before the call (used in pre-call contexts such as opening sentence or pre-call API).
- InCall: Variables collected or updated during the call.
- PostCall: Variables generated after the call by the platform (cannot be created via the API).

`1 - PreCall`

`2 - InCall`

`3 - PostCall`

type.description:
`1 - String`

`2 - Long`

`3 - Double`

`4 - Boolean`

`5 - DateOnly`

`6 - TimeOnly`

`7 - DateTime`

isList.description: Indicates whether the variable can contain multiple values (list) or a single value.

description.description:
Guidance for the agent on how to collect or infer this variable during the conversation.
            
Max 300 characters only.

options.description:
Optional predefined choices for this variable (allowed/preset values).
            
Notes:
- Use Value for the human-readable label.
- Use Code for an optional internal/normalized value to store or send to integrations.

group.description:
Variable group.

- PreCall: Variables available before the call (used in pre-call contexts such as opening sentence or pre-call API).
- InCall: Variables collected or updated during the call.
- PostCall: Variables generated after the call by the platform (cannot be created via the API).

`1 - PreCall`

`2 - InCall`

`3 - PostCall`

type.description:
`1 - String`

`2 - Long`

`3 - Double`

`4 - Boolean`

`5 - DateOnly`

`6 - TimeOnly`

`7 - DateTime`

isList.description: Indicates whether the variable holds multiple values (list) or a single value.

options.description: Predefined choices for the variable (if applicable).

required.description: Indicates whether the variable is required (based on where it is used in the Pearl configuration).

readOnly.description:
Indicates whether the variable is a platform-built preset.
If true, the variable can be used but cannot be modified or overridden.

from.description: The start date of the query range (inclusive).

to.description:
The end date of the query range (inclusive).  
Must not be more than 90 days after the `From` date.

DateSearch.description: Represents a date range used to query analytics data.

DayOfWeek.description:
`0 - Sunday`

`1 - Monday`

`2 - Tuesday`

`3 - Wednesday`

`4 - Thursday`

`5 - Friday`

`6 - Saturday`

day.description:
`0 - Sunday`

`1 - Monday`

`2 - Tuesday`

`3 - Wednesday`

`4 - Thursday`

`5 - Friday`

`6 - Saturday`

start.description:
Start time of the allowed calling window (based on the campaign time zone).
            
Constraints:
- Must be before End.

end.description:
End time of the allowed calling window (based on the campaign time zone).
            
Constraints:
- Must be after Start.

callIds.description: The list of unique call IDs to delete.

DeleteCallsRequestApi.description: Represents the request object used to delete one or more calls.

leadIds.description: A list of lead IDs to be deleted.

DeleteLeadsRequestApi.description: Represents the request object for deleting one or more leads associated with an outbound campaign.

leadExternalIds.description: A list of external lead IDs to be deleted.

DeleteLeadsbyExternalRequestApi.description: Represents the request object for deleting one or more leads associated with an outbound campaign using external identifiers.

to.description:
List of primary recipients.
            
Constraints:
- Max 10 recipients.
- Max 255 characters per email address.

cc.description:
List of CC recipients.
            
Constraints:
- Max 10 recipients.
- Max 255 characters per email address.

subject.description:
` May support variables`
            
Email subject.
            
Constraints:
- Max 150 characters.
- Supports pre-call, in-call, and post-call variables.

body.description:
` May support variables`
            
Email body content.
            
Constraints:
- Max 100,000 characters.
- Supports pre-call, in-call, and post-call variables.

triggerDescription.description:
Instructions describing when the email should be sent (trigger conditions).
            
Max 500 characters only.

smtpSettings.description:
Optional SMTP configuration used to send the email.
If not provided, the email is sent using the default platform email sender.

subject.description:
` May support variables`

Email subject.
            
Max 150 characters only.

body.description:
` May support variables`
            
Email body content.
            
Max 100,000 characters only.

triggerDescription.description:
Instructions describing when the email should be sent (trigger conditions).
            
Max 500 characters only.

smtpSettings.description:
Optional SMTP configuration used to send the email.
If not provided, the email is sent using the default platform email sender.

phoneNumberId.description:
The phone number ID to use for this Pearl.
To retrieve available phone numbers, see: [Get Phone Numbers](/api-reference/v2/pearlSettings/get-phones)
            
Constraints:
- A phone number cannot be assigned to more than one active inbound Pearl at the same time.

totalAgents.description: Total number of agents allocated to this inbound activity.

isStopRecordingAfterTransferCall.description: Indicates whether recording should continue after a call is transferred.

callWebhookUrl.description: Optional webhook URL to receive call events (for example call started and call ended).

waitingSentence.description:
Message played to the caller when no agent is available and the caller is waiting in the queue.
            
Max 300 characters only.

isSayQueueDetails.description: When enabled, the caller is informed about queue details (for example how many callers are ahead) while waiting.

language.description: The language for this group of voices.

voices.description: The list of voices available for this language.

id.description: The unique identifier of the lead, represented as an ObjectId.

externalId.description: The identifier for the lead from an external system, such as a CRM.

phoneNumber.description: The phone number of the lead.

timeZone.description: The time zone of the lead, represented as a float (e.g., -5.0 for EST).

status.description:
The Status of the lead is the status of the last conversation.

To determine the definition of 'Success' or 'Not Successful,' please refer to the [Create a Pearl](/pages/create_pearl#pearl-name) page at step 4.

`1 - New`

`10 - NeedRetry`

`20 - InCallQueue`

`30 - WrongCountryCode`

`40 - OnCall`

`70 - VoiceMailLeft`

`100 - Success`

`110 - NotSuccessful`

`130 - Completed`

`150 - Unreachable`

`220 - Blacklisted`

`300 - QueueAbandon`

`500 - Error`

created.description: The date and time when the lead was created.

callsId.description: The list of the ID's of all the calls this lead has received.

callData.description:
A dictionary containing additional information about the call.
It is used as variables that you can use in "Opening Sentence" or "Flow Script" when you create a Pearl on the platform.
The keys represent the field names, and the values contain the corresponding data.
This information can be used to personalize the conversation or manage lead-specific details.
This parameter is optional.
see [Variables](/pages/variables) for more information.
Here is an example of the json to send:
`{ "email" : "joe@gmail.com", "address": "3 Abbey Road UK" , "carLicense" : "90-929-82" }`

collectedData.description:
A dictionary containing all the information collected about the lead during the call.  
These values are the result of the conversation and reflect the answers or actions taken by the lead.  
The `key` represents the ID of the variable configured on the platform,  
and the `value` corresponds to the collected data.  
            
This information can be used to understand user intent, track specific responses, or power further automation.  
For more details on how variables work, see [Variables](/pages/variables).
            
Here is an example of the JSON format:
`{ "confirmBooking": true, "dropOffLocation": "Orly Airport", "rideTime": "Friday at 12:00", "userIntent": "Book a taxi to the airport" }`

id.description: The unique identifier of the call.

startTime.description: The date and time when the call processing started.

pearlId.description: The ID of the Pearl Used in This Call.

status.description:
Represents the current status of a call.

`3 - InProgress`

`4 - Completed`

`5 - Busy`

`6 - Failed`

`7 - NoAnswer`

`8 - Canceled`

from.description: The phone number from which the call was made.

name.description: The name associated with the call, if available.

collectedData.description: The object including all the information collected during the call.

duration.description: The duration of the call in seconds.

recording.description: The URL of the recording of the call, if available.

tags.description: The tags or labels triggered during the conversation

externalId.description: The external ID of the lead, typically from a CRM request or another external source.

phoneNumber.description: The phone number of the lead.

timeZoneId.description: The time zone of the lead.

status.description:
The Status of the lead is the status of the last conversation.

To determine the definition of 'Success' or 'Not Successful,' please refer to the [Create a Pearl](/pages/create_pearl#pearl-name) page at step 4.

`1 - New`

created.description: The date and time when the lead was created.

callData.description:
A dictionary containing additional information about the call.
It is used as variables that you can use in "Opening Sentence" or "Flow Script" when you create a Pearl on the platform.
The keys represent the field names, and the values contain the corresponding data.
This information can be used to personalize the conversation or manage lead-specific details.
This parameter is optional.
see [Variables](/pages/variables) for more information.
Here is an example of the json to send:
`{ "email" : "joe@gmail.com", "address": "3 Abbey Road UK" , "carLicense" : "90-929-82" }`

count.description: The total number of items matching the search criteria.

results.description: The list of results for the current page, based on the search criteria.

skip.description: Number of entries to skip for pagination.

limit.description: Limit on the number of entries to return.

isAscending.description: Whether the sort order is ascending.

statuses.description: Optional filters for the status of the leads. Only leads with this status will be included in the results.

LeadSearch.description: Extends TableSearch to include specific search criteria for leads.

phoneNumber.description: The phone number of the lead.

externalId.description: An optional external identifier for the lead.

timeZoneId.description:
Optional time zone identifier for the lead.  
If provided, this will override the default time zone configured at the outbound level.  
By default, an outbound campaign has a predefined time zone (set during creation or modified later on the platform),  
but you can assign a specific time zone to a lead by specifying this property.  

If not provided, the lead will use the outbound's default time zone.  

For valid values, refer to the "TimeZone" column in the following list:  
[Time Zone List](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-hardware/manufacture/desktop/default-time-zones?view=windows-11) 

Examples: `"Pacific Standard Time"`, `"Trkiye Standard Time"`

callData.description:
A dictionary containing additional information about the call.
It is used as variables that you can use in "Opening Sentence" or "Flow Script" when you create a Pearl on the platform.
The keys represent the field names, and the values contain the corresponding data.
This information can be used to personalize the conversation or manage lead-specific details.
This parameter is optional.

See [Variables](/pages/variables) for more information.
Here is an example of the json to send:

`{ "email" : "joe@gmail.com", "address": "3 Abbey Road UK" , "carLicense" : "90-929-82" }`

phoneNumber.description:
The updated phone number of the lead.  
If provided, it will replace the existing phone number.

externalId.description:
An updated external identifier for the lead.  
This can be used to link the lead with external systems.

timeZoneId.description:
Optional time zone identifier for the lead.  
If set, this overrides the default time zone configured on the outbound.  
For accepted values, refer to the [Windows Time Zones list](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-hardware/manufacture/desktop/default-time-zones?view=windows-11).  
Example: `"Pacific Standard Time"`, `"Trkiye Standard Time"`.

callData.description:
A dictionary containing additional lead information.  
These values can be used in the Pearl's "Opening Sentence" or "Flow Script".  
The `key` is the variable ID and the `value` is its value.  
See [Variables](/pages/variables) for more details.  
Example: `{ "email": "joe@gmail.com", "carLicense": "90-929-82" }`

status.description:
The new status to assign to the lead.

This can be used to update the lead's progression or interaction result.

For example, if you want the outbound campaign to stop calling this lead, you can set the status to `Completed`.
Or, if the lead already converted successfully in an external CRM, you can mark it directly as `Success`.

`1 - New`

`10 - NeedRetry`

`100 - Success`

`110 - NotSuccessful`

`130 - Completed`

LeadToUpdateApi.description:
Represents the data used to update an existing lead in an outbound campaign.
All fields are optional; only the provided values will be updated.

totalOngoingCalls.description: The total number of ongoing calls.

totalOnQueue.description: The total number of calls currently in the queue.

value.description:
The option value (human-readable label).
If Code is empty, this value is also used for display.

code.description:
Optional display/encoded value for the option.
Use this to store a mapped value (for example a normalized code, an internal identifier, or a hex color).

phoneNumberId.description:
The phone number ID to use for this Pearl.
To retrieve available phone numbers, see: [Get Phone Numbers](/api-reference/v2/pearlSettings/get-phones)

totalAgents.description: Total number of agents allocated to this outbound activity.

recordingTrack.description:
Call recording track selection.

- Both: Records both sides of the call (agent and lead/customer).
- Outbound: Records only the agent side.
- Inbound: Records only the lead/customer side.
- None: Disables call recording.

`1 - Outbound`

`2 - Inbound`

`3 - Both`

`4 - None`

isStopRecordingAfterTransferCall.description: Indicates whether recording should continue after a call is transferred.

budgetTotal.description:
Total budget allocated for the outbound activity.
If null, the outbound activity runs without a budget limit.

timeZone.description:
Default time zone for the outbound activity.
            
Leads are called according to this time zone unless a lead-specific time zone is provided when adding leads.
For accepted values, refer to the [Windows Time Zones list](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-hardware/manufacture/desktop/default-time-zones?view=windows-11).
            
Example: "Pacific Standard Time", "Romance Standard Time".

maximumCallAttempts.description:
Maximum number of call attempts per lead.
            
Constraints:
- Max 5 attempts.

minimumRetryIntervalHours.description:
`1 - Every6Hours`

`2 - OnceADay`

`3 - OnceEvery3Days`

`4 - OnceAWeek`

`5 - OnceAMonth`

`6 - Every3Hours`

ringDuration.description:
Ringing duration (in seconds) before considering the call unanswered.
            
Constraints:
- Min 10 seconds.
- Max 50 seconds.

callTimeout.description:
Maximum call duration (in minutes). The call is ended when this limit is reached.
            
Constraints:
- Min 1 minute.
- Max 120 minutes.

voiceMail.description:
` May support variables`
            
Voicemail message left when a voicemail/answering machine is detected.
If empty, the agent will not leave voicemails.
            
Notes:
- Supports pre-call variables only.
- When a voicemail is left, the call is marked as "voicemail left" and no further retries are attempted.
            
Max 500 characters only.

callingHours.description: Allowed calling hours for the outbound activity.

callWebhookUrl.description: Optional webhook URL to receive call events (for example call started and call ended).

leadWebhookUrl.description: Optional webhook URL to receive lead events (for example lead created/updated).

agents.description:
Agents configured for the Pearl.

- Each agent represents a language-specific entry point (based on the selected voice).
- Configure multiple agents to support multilingual experiences and language-based transfers.

Constraints:
- Voice language must be unique across agents (no duplicates).

agentPersonality.description:
Defines the agent's personality and tone (for example, more assertive or more calm).

Constraints:
- Max length: 35 characters.

timeZone.description:
Time zone identifier used by the Pearl's agents.
            
The agent will operate according to this time zone, regardless of the lead/customer local time zone.
For accepted values, refer to the [Windows Time Zones list](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-hardware/manufacture/desktop/default-time-zones?view=windows-11).
            
Example: "Pacific Standard Time", "Romance Standard Time".

modelType.description:
Agent model type.

- Trident: Default, highest-quality model with standard rate. Optimized for natural, human-like interactions.
- Oyster: Most cost-effective model (2 credits cheaper per minute). Straightforward, prioritizes simplicity and efficiency.
- Arrow: High-intelligence model with the same depth as Trident, built for ultra-low latency (fastest). Costs 2 credits more per minute.

`1 - Trident`

`2 - Oyster`

`3 - Arrow`

companyName.description:
The company name used by the agent during conversations.
            
Constraints:
- Max length: 100 characters.

companyDescription.description:
The company name used by the agent during conversations.
            
Constraints:
- Max length: 500 characters.

knowledgeBase.description:
Knowledge base content provided to the agent, such as FAQs, internal context, and operational instructions.
            
Constraints:
- Max length: 20,000 characters.

memory.description: Indicates whether memory is enabled. When enabled, the Pearl can remember previous conversations for a given phone number.

speechRecognitionKeywords.description:
Keywords configured to improve speech recognition accuracy (for example product names, acronyms, or domain-specific terms).
            
Constraints:
- Max entries: 10.

openingSentence.description:
` may include variables`

The opening sentence spoken by the agent when a conversation starts.
            
Constraints:
-Max 500 characters only.
-Supports pre-call variables only.

flowScript.description:
` may include variables`

The flow script the agent follows to drive the conversation.
            
Constraints:
- Max 20,000 characters.
- Supports pre-call variables and in-call variables.

transferCallSettings.description:
Call transfer rules configured for the Pearl (when and where calls should be transferred).
            
Constraints:
- Max rules: 10.

smsSettings.description:
SMS templates and triggers configured for the Pearl.
            
During a call, the agent can send SMS messages based on these rules.
            
Constraints:
- Max templates: 10.

emailSettings.description:
Email templates and triggers configured for the Pearl.
            
During a call, the agent can send emails based on these rules.
            
Constraints:
- Max templates: 10.

apiSettings.description:
API actions configured for the Pearl.
            
Constraints:
- Max actions: 10.

successDescription.description:
Definition of what is considered a successful call for this Pearl.
This is used to classify call outcomes as successful or not successful.
            
If left empty, calls will only be marked as completed (no success classification).
            
Max 200 characters only.

indicatorTags.description:
Indicator labels that can be applied to calls for classification and reporting.
            
At the end of the conversation, an AI analyzes the call and determines which of the configured labels should be applied.
            
Constraints:
- Max labels: 10.

notifications.description:
Notifications configured to be triggered when a call ends.
            
A notification can trigger an API call or send an email when specific indicator tags are detected.
            
Constraints:
- Max notifications: 30.
- Each notification must reference indicator tag IDs (not tag names).

id.description: The unique identifier of the pearl.

type.description:
Defines the type of activity of the pearl.

`1 - Inbound`

`2 - Outbound`

status.description:
Here is the activity status

`1 - Running`

`2 - Paused`

`3 - Suspended`

`10 - TemporaryMaintenance`

phoneNumber.description: The phone number assigned to the pearl.

totalAgents.description: The total number of agents allocated to the pearl.

created.description: The date and time when the pearl was created.

budgetConsumed.description: The amount of budget consumed so far for the pearl.

totalTodayCalls.description: The total number of calls made today for the pearl.

totalOngoingCalls.description: The total number of ongoing calls for the pearl.

totalOnQueue.description: The number of calls currently waiting in the queue (inbound only).

totalLeads.description: The total number of leads associated with the pearl (outbound only).

totalLeadsCompleted.description: The total number of leads that have been completed (outbound only).

totalLeadsSuccess.description: The total number of leads successfully converted (outbound only).

budgetTotal.description: The total budget allocated for the pearl (outbound only).

type.description:
Defines the type of activity of the pearl.

`1 - Inbound`

`2 - Outbound`

pearl.description:
Conversation flow and agent behavior configuration for the Pearl.
            
This field is populated only if the Pearl was created via the API.
If the Pearl was created through the platform interface, this field will be empty.

variables.description:
Variables defined for the Pearl and used by the agent during conversations.
            
This field is populated only if the Pearl was created via the API.
If the Pearl was created through the platform interface, this field will be empty.

inbound.description: Inbound settings for the Pearl. Present only when the Pearl type is inbound.

outbound.description: Outbound settings for the Pearl. Present only when the Pearl type is outbound.

id.description: The unique identifier of the pearl.

createdAt.description: The date and time when the pearl was created.

type.description:
Defines the type of activity of the pearl.

`1 - Inbound`

`2 - Outbound`

status.description:
Here is the activity status

`1 - Running`

`2 - Paused`

`3 - Suspended`

`10 - TemporaryMaintenance`

body.description:
` May support variables`
            
The SMS message content.
            
Constraints:
- Max 2,000 characters.
- Supports pre-call and in-call variables.
- If sent at end of call, may also support post-call variables.

triggerDescription.description:
Instructions describing when the SMS should be sent (trigger conditions).
            
Max 500 characters only.

isActive.description:
A boolean value that specifies the new active status of the entity.

True activates the entity, while false deactivates it.

SetActiveRequest.description: Defines the request structure for setting the active status of an entity.

enableSsl.description: Indicates whether SSL/TLS is enabled for the SMTP connection.

senderEmail.description: Sender email address used for SMTP authentication and as the "From" address.

senderPassword.description: Sender password or SMTP credential used for authentication.

displayName.description: Display name shown in the recipient inbox (the "From" name).

transferCallPhoneNumber.description:
` May support variables`
            
The destination phone number to transfer the call to.
If a variable is used, it must resolve to a valid phone number, otherwise the transfer will fail.
            
Max 25 characters only.

triggerDescription.description:
Instructions describing when the agent should transfer the call (for example, when the caller asks to speak with a human).
            
Max 500 characters only.

warmTransferMessage.description:
` May support variables`
            
Optional warm transfer message spoken by the agent when the transfer starts.
If empty, warm transfer is disabled.
            
Max 2,000 characters only.

name.description: The updated name of the Pearl.

pearl.description: Updated conversation flow and agent behavior configuration for the Pearl.

variables.description:
Variables that can be defined, stored, and used by the agent during conversations.
For details on variable groups and how to use variables in supported fields, see: [Flow Variables](/api-reference/flow_variables)

roleId.description: The identifier of the role assigned to the user (used for permissions).

roleName.description: The name of the role assigned to the user.

createdAt.description: The date and time when the user was added to the account.

word.description:
The keyword to recognize in speech recognition.
            
- Max length: 50 characters.

pronunciations.description:
Alternative pronunciations for the keyword.
            
Constraints:
- Max elements: 3.
- Each pronunciation max length: 50 characters.

id.description: The unique identifier of the voice.

name.description: The display name of the voice.

tags.description: Tags describing the voice (for example accent, style, or other voice characteristics).

eActivityStatus.description:
Here is the activity status

`1 - Running`

`2 - Paused`

`3 - Suspended`

`10 - TemporaryMaintenance`

eBrainModelType.description:
Agent model type.

- Trident: Default, highest-quality model with standard rate. Optimized for natural, human-like interactions.
- Oyster: Most cost-effective model (2 credits cheaper per minute). Straightforward, prioritizes simplicity and efficiency.
- Arrow: High-intelligence model with the same depth as Trident, built for ultra-low latency (fastest). Costs 2 credits more per minute.

`1 - Trident`

`2 - Oyster`

`3 - Arrow`

eCallAuthorizationStatus.description:
Represents the authorization status for making calls.

`1 - FullAccess`

`2 - LimitedAccess`

`3 - NoCredits`

`4 - SuspendedAccount`

`5 - DebtReached`

eCallStatusView.description:
Represents the current status of a call.

`3 - InProgress`

`4 - Completed`

`5 - Busy`

`6 - Failed`

`7 - NoAnswer`

`8 - Canceled`

eConversationStatusView.description:
The outcome of the conversation during the call.

To determine the definition of 'Success' or 'Not Successful,' please refer to the [Create a Pearl](/pages/create_pearl#pearl-name) page at step 4.

`10 - NeedRetry`

`20 - InCallQueue`

`40 - OnCall`

`70 - VoiceMailLeft`

`100 - Success`

`110 - NotSuccessful`

`130 - Completed`

`150 - Unreachable`

`220 - Blacklisted`

`300 - QueueAbandon`

`500 - Error`

eDataSettingsGroup.description:
Variable group.

- PreCall: Variables available before the call (used in pre-call contexts such as opening sentence or pre-call API).
- InCall: Variables collected or updated during the call.
- PostCall: Variables generated after the call by the platform (cannot be created via the API).

`1 - PreCall`

`2 - InCall`

`3 - PostCall`

eLeadStatusInputApi.description:
The new status to assign to the lead.

This can be used to update the lead's progression or interaction result.

For example, if you want the outbound campaign to stop calling this lead, you can set the status to `Completed`.
Or, if the lead already converted successfully in an external CRM, you can mark it directly as `Success`.

`1 - New`

`10 - NeedRetry`

`100 - Success`

`110 - NotSuccessful`

`130 - Completed`

eLeadStatusInputView.description:
`1 - New`

`10 - NeedRetry`

`20 - InCallQueue`

`30 - WrongCountryCode`

`40 - OnCall`

`70 - VoiceMailLeft`

`100 - Success`

`110 - NotSuccessful`

`130 - Completed`

`150 - Unreachable`

`200 - Deleted`

`220 - Blacklisted`

`500 - Error`

eLeadStatusView.description:
The Status of the lead is the status of the last conversation.

To determine the definition of 'Success' or 'Not Successful,' please refer to the [Create a Pearl](/pages/create_pearl#pearl-name) page at step 4.

`1 - New`

`10 - NeedRetry`

`20 - InCallQueue`

`30 - WrongCountryCode`

`40 - OnCall`

`70 - VoiceMailLeft`

`100 - Success`

`110 - NotSuccessful`

`130 - Completed`

`150 - Unreachable`

`220 - Blacklisted`

`300 - QueueAbandon`

`500 - Error`

eMinimumRetryIntervalHours.description:
`1 - Every6Hours`

`2 - OnceADay`

`3 - OnceEvery3Days`

`4 - OnceAWeek`

`5 - OnceAMonth`

`6 - Every3Hours`

eOverallSentiment.description:
Represents the overall emotional tone detected from the client during the conversation.

`1 - Negative`

`2 - SlightlyNegative`

`3 - Neutral`

`4 - SlightlyPositive`

`5 - Positive`

ePhoneNumberDirection.description:
Phone number direction (supported call capabilities).

- InboundOutbound: Supports both inbound and outbound calls.
- Inbound: Supports inbound calls only.
- Outbound: Supports outbound calls only.
- NotSet: Direction is not set.

`1 - InboundOutbound`

`2 - Inbound`

`3 - Outbound`

`10 - NotSet`

ePredefinedCallLabelColors.description:
`1 - purple`

`2 - red`

`3 - yellow`

`4 - green`

`5 - blue`

`6 - pink`

`7 - teal`

`8 - lime`

`8 - gradient1`

`9 - gradient2`

eProjectType.description:
Defines the type of activity of the pearl.

`1 - Inbound`

`2 - Outbound`

eRecordingTrack.description:
Call recording track selection.

- Both: Records both sides of the call (agent and lead/customer).
- Outbound: Records only the agent side.
- Inbound: Records only the lead/customer side.
- None: Disables call recording.

`1 - Outbound`

`2 - Inbound`

`3 - Both`

`4 - None`

eStateDataType.description:
`1 - String`

`2 - Long`

`3 - Double`

`4 - Boolean`

`5 - DateOnly`

`6 - TimeOnly`

`7 - DateTime`

bearer_auth.description:
Specify the authorization token.

For more information, check out the [Authorization Guide](/api-reference/authorization).
